conclusion: The mass of object A is m = 2 kg, the spring constant of spring B is k1 = 200 N/m, the spring constant of spring C is k2, the initial position of the right endpoint of spring C is at a, the distance ab = 60 cm = 0.6 m, and the tension force of spring B on object A is equal to the gravitational force of A when the right endpoint of spring C is at position b.
Initially, spring B is in its natural length, so there is no displacement in spring B. The force in spring B is zero.

When the right endpoint of spring C is at position b, the horizontal displacement of the right endpoint of spring C is x = 0.6 m. The vertical displacement of the left endpoint of spring C is the same as the vertical displacement of object A. Let this vertical displacement be h.
The force in spring B is FB = mg = 2 Ã— 9.8 = 19.6 N (since the tension in spring B is equal to the gravitational force of A).
The force in spring C is T = k2 h.
The vertical component of the force in spring C must balance the weight of A. Therefore, T = mg = 19.6 N. Since T = k2 h, we have k2 h = 19.6.
From the equation k2 h = 19.6, we can solve for h: h = 19.6/k2.
The height that object A rises is the vertical displacement h.
The height that object A rises is h = 19.6/k2. The stiffness coefficient k2 is not given, but the height h is expressed in terms of k2.
